basics.name: Katelynn Crouch
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am currently pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa, with an expected graduation date of Spring 2027. Following the completion of my undergraduate degree, I plan to continue my studies at the University of Hawai‘i to pursue a Master’s degree in Computer Science.

work.company: UH Manoa Information and Computer Sciences Department
work.summary: Advises first and second-year ICS students, connects them with opportunities, and supports departmental programming.
highlights: Proactively guided and supported 100+ students in course selection, improving understanding of academic pathways and informed decision-making
Facilitated access to academic/career resources, empowering students to pursue internships and scholarships
Collaborated with faculty on Welina Mānoa, CNS Welcome Day, and Group Advising, contributing to a ~5% increase in participation and engagement in departmental activities

volunteer.organization: UH Mānoa Association for Computing Machinery (ACM)
volunteer.summary: Plans and executes chapter-wide events, aligns SIGs, and leads cross-team operations.
highlights: Led planning and execution of 5+ chapter events with seamless cross-team coordination
Achieved 100% alignment with event objectives in partnership with ACM sections and SIGs
Represented ACM in external planning meetings, strengthening visibility and campus partnerships
Key projects: Kekuhaupi’o Tech Mentorship, Career in Tech & Intelligence Fair, ACM General Meeting,

volunteer.organization: UH Mānoa ACM Software Development Team
volunteer.summary: Contributed to React-based applications serving ACM and student users.
highlights: Developed and maintained 3+ web applications using React as part of the club’s software solutions
Collaborated in a small, agile team to deliver on-time, spec-compliant features
High-impact contributions: Attendance Tracker, ACM Website Maintenance, Datathon Website

awards.title: Student of the Month
awards.summary: TTo provide visible recognition at our monthly meetings for those public and private students, including college level, who have demonstrated academic excellence to their school staff, to encourage young persons to enter STEM fields, and to encourage superior performance while in school.

awards.title: The President's Volunteer Service Award
awards.summary: The President's Volunteer Service Award is a civil award bestowed by the President of the United States.
